In grammar, a postpositional word or phrase comes after a word or group of words that it is related to. A postpositional language is one where this happens: There are several types of postpositional particles in Japanese. In the postpositional languages, this mark of tense is always placed after the verbal root. Several of the indigenous languages of North America are postpositional.
